      • fitsInto

        public static <T extends Number> boolean fitsInto​(Number n,
                                                  Class<T> targetType)
        Returns whether or not the specified Number can be converted an instance of the Number type without losing of information.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of Number to convert to
        Parameters:
        n - The Number to convert
        targetType - The type of Number to convert to
        Returns:
        Whether or not conversion will be lossless

      • asPlainInt

        public static int asPlainInt​(String s)
                      throws NumberFormatException
        Parses the specified string into an int. This method is substantially more restrictive than Integer.parseInt. It uses BigDecimal.intValueExact() and BigDecimal.scale() to make sure the string represents an integer. It does not accept a decimal point or any decimal fraction (even if consisting of zeros only). It also does not accept strings using scientific notation.

        Examples of invalid input: 

        7F
        		Not an integer
        .7
        		Not an integer
        7.0
        		Scale is 1
        7.
        		Decimal point not allowed
        123456789123456789
        		Overflow
        3.4e+2
        		Scientific notation

        Any error occuring while parsing the argument will be converted to a NumberFormatException. This includes the argument being null and any ArithmeticException thrown by BigDecimal.intValueExact.

        Parameters:
        s - The string to parse
        Returns:
        An integer
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - If anything goes wrong while parsing the string
